subtitle: paper 131 the world's religions
during the alexandrian sojourn of jesus
gonad and ganid
the young man spent much of his time in
no small sum of his father's money
making a collection of the teaching of
the world's religions about god and his
relations with mortal man
ganid employed more than three score
learned translators in the making of
this abstract
of the religious doctrines of the world
concerning the deities
and it should be made plain in this
record that all these teachings
portraying monotheism
were largely derived directly or
indirectly from the preachments
of the missionaries of macaventa
melchizedek
who went forth from their salem
headquarters to spread the doctrine of
one god
the most high to the ends of the earth
there is presented here with an abstract
of ghanid's manuscript
which he prepared at alexandria and rome
and which was preserved in
india for hundreds of years after his
death he collected his material under
ten heads
as follows one
cynicism the residual teachings of the
disciples of melchizedek
accepting those which persisted in the
jewish religion
were best preserved in the doctrines of
the cynics

following

three buddhism gennid was shocked to
discover how near buddhism came to be in
a great and beautiful religion without
god
without a personal and universal deity
however he did find some record of
certain earlier beliefs
which reflected something of the
influence of the teaching of the
melchizedek missionaries
who continued their work in india even
to the times of buddha
